abstract.textEnglish: This study presents a high porous nanocomposite composed of reduced graphene oxide and NiMoS<sub>4</sub> (RGO/NiMoS<sub>4</sub>) for supercapacitor electrode materials. The different morphologies of NiMoS<sub>4</sub> growth on RGO sheets were obtained via a facile one-step microwave-assisted method. The obtained material comprised NiMoS<sub>4</sub> nanoneedles of several nanometers in diameter, which are well attached to the surface of RGO nanosheets. The RGO/NiMoS<sub>4</sub> nanocomposite had a mesoporous structure, high specific surface area, and high electric conductivity. These excellent characteristics yield a fast electron and ion transport, and a large number of electroactive sites. The RGO/NiMoS<sub>4</sub> composite delivered a specific capacitance of 1273 F g<sup>1</sup> at a current density of 1.0 A g<sup>1</sup>, high-rate capability of 71.3 retention from 1 to 6.5 A g<sup>1</sup>. Besides, an asymmetric supercapacitor device had a capacitance of 80 F g<sup>1</sup> at a current density of 1.0 A g<sup>1</sup> and an energy density of 82.5 Wh kg<sup>1</sup> at a power density of 1000 W kg<sup>1</sup> with an operating voltage of 1.6 V. Thus, the current RGO/NiMoS<sub>4</sub> nanocomposite has a great potential for energy storage application.

title.textEnglish: Highly porous nanocomposite of NiMoS<sub>4</sub> nanosheets and reduced graphene oxide for energy storage application
